intro: Pentacalia mamancanacana, commonly known as the Mamancana pentacalia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and rocky soils, adapting to the harsh environmental conditions of its habitat. Its flowers are usually blue or purple, with five petals, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
